meanings.definition: A person who avidly follows and collects news.
meanings.sent1: The newshounds in our class always know the latest headlines.
meanings.sent2: The newshounds gathered every morning to discuss the news.
meanings.sent3: The newshounds were like walking newspapers, always up to date.
meanings.sent4: She sniffed out news like a newshound on a trail.
meanings.sent5: The newshounds' ears perked up at the sound of breaking news.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who are dedicated to gathering and reporting news.
meanings.sent1: The newshounds at the press conference asked insightful questions.
meanings.sent2: The newshounds worked tirelessly to uncover the truth.
meanings.sent3: The newshounds' office was filled with the buzz of breaking stories.
meanings.sent4: Their team operated like a pack of newshounds on the hunt for a scoop.
meanings.sent5: The newshounds' cameras captured every moment of the event.

meanings.definition: To actively seek out and consume news content.
meanings.sent1: She newshounds every morning by reading the newspaper.
meanings.sent2: They newshound online for the latest updates.
meanings.sent3: He newshounds so much, he's always the first to know.
meanings.sent4: Like a detective, she newshounds for clues in every article.
meanings.sent5: They newshound voraciously, never missing a headline.
